++ Automotive Maintenance Tire Removal


+++ SUMMARY

  1. Remove Valve core (right tight, left loose)
      - unscrew slowly, air pressure can cause core to shoot out.
      - Tool ("4-way tool"):
        - rel://files/_11A5JIXGNEJ2EOET2VZM.png
        - rel://files/_F3L1N3S87A715MWU21HQ.png
        
        - Use the removal tool side (pointed to above, shown below)
        - Twist to remove the valve core.
          - rel://files/_9IALFIYQRTD8FY55L75Y.png
          - valve core:
          - rel://files/_QYODWIWWG1FWF3ZYWF96.png
        - Clean inside of valve stem before replacing
        
  2. Remove clip on tire weights, and sticky ones?
  
  3. Break the bead in the tire using the pry bar,and the tool
     careful not to damage wheel, place it right outside of wheel, where tire meets, on tire.\
     watch out for tire pressure sensors, dont push down on them.
     
    [file:///C:/Users/koersg/Desktop/Automotive/Maintenance/Tires/2-RemovalOfTire.JPG]
  
  
  4.  Remove the cylindrical guy, star guy, and note the centering pin that should go through somewhere in the wheel to keep it in place.
      rel://files/_QSGM8B9AZIOCIVNPALT8.png
  
  
  5. Mount the tire, through the pin, then place star guy, then cylinder guy screws back on. 
     You can further tighten cylinder guy with the large bar (image 2)
      rel://files/_AF92CVWP9CF48STRU24Q.png
      rel://files/_VIKD2EPARMDC7NFJN76L.png
  
  6. Lube the "bead" on wheel and tire, where they meet with (???)
     Careful with choice of material, as unwanted material inside tire could be bad
      rel://files/_3YKKO06H5J8PSFJZJYW3.png
  
  7. Remove tire
